toggle.heading: Here are the best liberal arts colleges in the U.S.

hero.title: National Liberal Arts Colleges
hero.description: The National Liberal Arts Colleges, including schools like Colby College and Wesleyan University, emphasize undergraduate education and award at least half of their degrees in the liberal arts fields of study.
hero.subtitle: Here are the best liberal arts colleges in the U.S.

items.blurb: Founded in 1904, Brewton-Parker College is a private institution. Brewton-Parker College follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered least selective.
Founded in 1880, Bridgewater College is a private institution. The school has 53.8% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at Bridgewater College is 13:1.

institution.footnote: This school declined to fill out the U.S. News & World Report main statistical survey. Data that appears is from either what the school reported in previous years or from another source, such as the National Center for Education Statistics.

items.blurb: Founded in 1837, Cheyney University of Pennsylvania is a public institution.
Founded in 1848, Chowan University is a private institution. Chowan University follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered least selective.

institution.footnote: This school declined to fill out the U.S. News & World Report main statistical survey. Data that appears is from either what the school reported in previous years or from another source, such as the National Center for Education Statistics.

acceptanceRate.noteText: Data reported to U.S. News in previous years

items.blurb: Founded in 1869, Dillard University is a private institution.

institution.footnote: This school declined to fill out the U.S. News & World Report main statistical survey. Data that appears is from either what the school reported in previous years or from another source, such as the National Center for Education Statistics.

items.blurb: Founded in 1980, East-West University is a private institution.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1919, Emmanuel College (MA) is a private institution. Emmanuel College (MA) follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.
Founded in 1866, Fisk University is a private institution. The school has 63.9% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at Fisk University is 13:1.
Founded in 1911, Fort Lewis College is a public institution.
Founded in 1829, Georgetown College is a private institution. Georgetown College follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered more selective.

utag_data.stitial_fact: The U.S. states that hosted the most international students during the 2014-2015 academic year were California, New York and Texas.
